section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the report required to be prepared under section 388(1) of the Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the consolidated report required to be prepared under section 388(2) of the Ordinance;

section.def: parent company (母公司) means a parent undertaking that is a company; (L.N. 47 of 2013)
parent undertaking (母企業) has the same meaning as in Part 9 of the Ordinance; (35 of 2018 s. 97)
reporting exemption (提交報告豁免) means a reporting exemption within the meaning of Division 2 of Part 9 of the Ordinance; (L.N. 47 of 2013)

def.name: SpecifiedUndertaking
def.leadIn: specified undertaking (指明企業), in relation to a company, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a parent company of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a subsidiary undertaking of the company; or

paragraph.name: c

section.def: subsidiary undertaking (附屬企業) has the same meaning as in Part 9 of the Ordinance. (35 of 2018 s. 97)

subsection.leadIn: A directors’ report for a financial year must contain a statement that complies with subsection (3) if, at the end of the financial year, there subsists arrangements—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: whose objects are, or one of whose objects is, to enable directors of the company to acquire benefits by means of the acquisition of shares in, or debentures of, the company or any other body corporate.

subsection.leadIn: A directors’ report for a financial year must contain a statement that complies with subsection (3) if at any time in the financial year there have subsisted arrangements—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: whose objects were, or one of whose objects was, to enable directors of the company to acquire benefits by means of the acquisition of shares in, or debentures of, the company or any other body corporate.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: explain the effect of the arrangements referred to in subsection (1) or (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give the names of the persons who at any time in that financial year were directors of the company and held, or whose nominees held, shares or debentures acquired under the arrangements.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: Subsections (1) and (2) do not apply in respect of a company that falls within the reporting exemption for the financial year. (L.N. 47 of 2013)

subsection.def: shares (股份) has the meaning given by section 1(1) of Schedule 1 to the Ordinance. (35 of 2018 s. 98)

subsection.leadIn: If a specified company— (14 of 2025 s. 82)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has no subsidiary undertakings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has in a financial year made donations for charitable or other purposes to a total amount of not less than $10,000,

subsection.continued: a directors’ report for the financial year must state the total amount of those donations.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a specified company has subsidiary undertakings; and (14 of 2025 s. 82)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company has in a financial year made donations (whether on its own or by its subsidiary undertakings) for charitable or other purposes to a total amount of not less than $10,000,

subsection.continued: a directors’ report for the financial year must state the total amount of those donations.

subsection.def: wholly owned subsidiary (全資附屬公司) is to be construed in accordance with section 357(3) of the Ordinance. (14 of 2025 s. 82)

section.name: s5
section.heading: Shares issued
section.leadIn: If, in any financial year of a company, the company has issued any shares, a directors’ report for the financial year must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reason for making the issue;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the classes of shares issued; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for each class of shares, the number of shares issued and the consideration received by the company for the issue.

section.name: s5A
section.heading: Debentures issued
section.leadIn: If, in any financial year of a company, the company has issued any debentures, a directors’ report for the financial year must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reason for making the issue;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the classes of debentures issued; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for each class of debentures, the amount issued and the consideration received by the company for the issue.

subsection.leadIn: If, in any financial year of a company, the company has entered into an equity-linked agreement, a directors’ report for the financial year must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reason for entering into the agreement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the nature and terms of the agreement including, if applicable—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the conditions that must be met before the company issues any shares;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the conditions that must be met before a third party may require the company to issue any shares; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any monetary or other consideration that the company has received or will receive under the agreement;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the classes of shares issued under the agreement; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for each class of shares, the number of shares that have been issued under the agreement.

subsection.leadIn: If, at the end of a financial year of a company, there subsists an equity-linked agreement entered into by the company, a directors’ report for the financial year must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the classes of shares that may be issued under the agreement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for each class of shares, the number of shares that may be issued under the agreement;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any monetary or other consideration that the company has received or will receive under the agreement; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other conditions or terms that remain to be met before the shares are issued.

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an agreement that will or may result in the company issuing shares; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an agreement requiring the company to enter into the agreement specified in subparagraph (i); and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an option to subscribe for shares;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an agreement for the issue of securities that are convertible into, or entitle the holder to subscribe for, shares in the company;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an agreement to subscribe for shares in a company that is entered into pursuant to the company’s offer of its shares to the public; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an agreement to subscribe for shares in a company that is entered into pursuant to an offer made to the members of the company in proportion to their shareholdings;

subsection.def: offer (要約) includes an invitation to the public to subscribe for shares in a company.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Recommended dividend
section.content: A directors’ report for a financial year must state the amount (if any) that the directors of the company recommend should be paid by way of dividend for the financial year.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a director of a company has in a financial year resigned from the office or refused to stand for re-election to the office; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company has received a notice in writing from the director specifying that the resignation or refusal is due to reasons relating to the affairs of the company (whether or not other reasons are specified).

subsection.content: A directors’ report for the financial year must contain a summary of the reasons relating to the affairs of the company.
This section does not apply in respect of a company that falls within the reporting exemption for the financial year.

If, when a directors’ report prepared by the directors of a company is approved in a financial year of the company in accordance with section 391(1)(a) of the Ordinance, a permitted indemnity provision (whether made by the company or otherwise) is in force for the benefit of one or more directors of the company, or of its associated company, the directors’ report for the financial year must contain a statement that the permitted indemnity provision is in force as required by section 470 of the Ordinance.

If, at any time in the financial year to which a directors’ report prepared by the directors of a company relates, a permitted indemnity provision (whether made by the company or otherwise) was in force for the benefit of one or more persons who were then directors of the company, or of its associated company, the directors’ report for the financial year must contain a statement that the permitted indemnity provision was in force as required by section 470 of the Ordinance.

def.name: PermittedIndemnityProvision
def.leadIn: permitted indemnity provision (獲准許的彌償條文), in relation to a company, means a provision that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provides for indemnity against liability incurred by a director of the company to a third party; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: meets the requirements specified in section 469(2) of the Ordinance;

subsection.def: third party (第三者), in relation to a company, means a person other than the company or its associated company.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Material interests in transaction, arrangement or contract

subsection.leadIn: A directors’ report for a financial year of a company must state the particulars of any transaction, arrangement or contract—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: entered into by a specified undertaking of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in which a person who at any time in the financial year of the company was a director of the company had, directly or indirectly, a material interest.

subsection.leadIn: The particulars referred to in subsection (1) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the principal terms of the transaction, arrangement or contract;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fact that the transaction, arrangement or contract was entered into or subsisted in the financial year;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the names of the parties to the transaction, arrangement or contract;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the name of the director having the material interest and the nature of that interest; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: (if the director is treated as having the material interest by virtue of subsection (3)) the name of the director’s connected entity and the nature of the connection.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, a director of a public company is treated as having a material interest in a transaction, arrangement or contract entered into by a specified undertaking of the company if a connected entity of that director has a material interest in that transaction, arrangement or contract.
In this section, a reference to a transaction, arrangement or contract is a reference to a transaction, arrangement or contract that is significant in relation to the company’s business.

For the purposes of subsection (4), a transaction, arrangement or contract is not significant in relation to the company’s business if, after consideration, the directors of the company are of the opinion that it is not significant in relation to the company’s business.

For the purposes of this section, an interest that a director of a company has in a transaction, arrangement or contract is not material if, after consideration, the directors of the company are of the opinion that it is not material.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not apply in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company that falls within the reporting exemption for the financial year;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a transaction, arrangement or contract unless it was entered into in the financial year or subsisted at any time in that year;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a transaction, arrangement or contract between the company and its specified undertaking in which a director of the company has a material interest; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a director’s contract of service.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a director includes a shadow director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to a connected entity, in relation to a director, is a reference to an entity connected with the director within the meaning of section 486 of the Ordinance.
